trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission"></xref> object controls the ability to create the WebBrowser control.
In the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF), the Web browser control enables frames to navigate HTML.
This permission uses the values of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission> enumerations.
XAML Attribute Usage
This class is not typically used in XAML.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission"></xref> class.
By default, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel.Safe>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission"></xref> class by specifying a permission state.

If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.Unrestricted>, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel.Unrestricted>.

If `state` is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState.None>, the value of the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel.None>.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState"></xref>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission"></xref> class by specifying the Web browser permission level.
An enumerated value of <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel"></xref>.
Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
A copy of the current permission.
Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the permission.
Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
A permission to intersect with the current permission.
It must be of the same type as the current permission.
The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the state that they both describe in common.
Only a demand that passes both original permissions will be valid for the intersected permission.
Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission.
For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\.
If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
A permission that is to be tested for the subset relationship.
This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
`true` if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, `false`.
Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
An unrestricted permission represents access to any and all resources protected by the permission.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermission.Level"></xref> property is set to <xref href="System.Security.Permissions.WebBrowserPermissionLevel.Unrestricted"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the current value of the Web browser permission level.
XAML Attribute Usage

Members of this class are either not typically used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], or cannot be used in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)].
The current value of the Web browser permission level.
Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
An XML encoding of the permission, including any state information.
Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
XAML Attribute Usage
Members of this class are either not typically used in XAML, or cannot be used in XAML.
A permission to combine with the current permission.
It must be of the same type as the current permission.
A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
